data.title: EZ-FLASH OMEGA test flight
data.meta_description:
I'll post the test version of kernel and firmware in this thread.   please reply the bug report in it too.  please don't reply off-topic post.

Test version...

#1

I'll post the test version of kernel and firmware in this thread. please reply the bug report in it too. please don't reply off-topic post.

Test version updates very frequently, it will add new functions, quick fix of known issues. But it may be unstable with unknown bugs. It is not suitable for beginners.

Use it at your own risk.

bug report template

1. Game console type

2. Firmware version

3. Kernel version

4. MicroSD type

5. MicroSD format

6. MicroSD cluster size or allocation unit size

7. Bug description

8. Bug reproduce steps (This is very important, only the reproducible bug can be fixed quickly.)

Now testing kernel 1.04 and firmware 6

current version kernel 1.04T1 firmware 6 display 99

T1

Removed Fire Emblem series autosave in the battle, only manual save and chapter save can be saved.

Added a new save-states mode with better compatibility. just check the save-states mark only. there is no in-game menu. L+R+SELECT = SAVE. L+R+START=LOAD.

Last edited by EZ-Flash2, Aug 8, 2018

#2

Common to both:

1. GBA SP

2. 3

3. 1.02T2

4. Sandisk 4GB SDHC

5. Fat32

6. 32KB

Bug 1:

7. Sonic Spinball Party US boots to white screen.

8. Boot with Addons or Clean Boot, with A or with L+A, Save <Auto>

Bug 2:

7. During fade out, Reset Menu can be invisible.

8. In Metroid Fusion in game, Hold L, Press Start, and when the screen is black R.

Is this due to a GBA special effect and not fixable? I don't see a note about it in the manual.

Last edited by kuwanger, Apr 18, 2018

bug 1. it was fixed in firmware v4

bug 2. the in-game menu render shares GBA gamma register. it can be fixed late.

#6

Firmware version: v3

Kernel version: 1.02T2

Bug description:

A-Z sorting places special characters last rather than first. This runs contrary to the EZ4's file-list, and most file-sorting conventions, where it is useful to add a special character to a folder's name to ensure it appears at the top of the list.

Reproduction:

Create a folder such as "_ROMS", it will be displayed beneath other folders.

#13

I bought the EZ Flash Omega and it had the Version Firmware 3.0 and Kernel 1.01

1. DS and DS Lite

2. Firmware 4.0

3. Kernel 1.02 final

4. Sandisk 2GB, Sandisk Ultra 32GB (Class 10, UHS-I, SDHC) and Samsung 32GB (Class 10, UHS-I, SDHC)

5. Fat32, Fat16 (Sandisk 2GB only)

6. 32KB

7. Always freezes when playing longer (mostly 30min and higher).

Sometimes play after the 30 minutes and turn off the DS device and turn it back on for a few seconds or 1 minute later freeze again.

In the moment it freezes. You can still hear the sound of the game. But mostly it is broken.

8. Tested with:

0755 - Metroid Fusion

1452 - Metroid Zero Mission

2185 - Pokemon Emerald

2422 - Ultimate Spider Man

Last edited by BasicIncomeFan, May 16, 2018

#17

Still as power hungry as before.

1. Original GBA. No screen mod or anything.

2. 5T

3. 1.03T

[The ones you posted above]

4. Sandisk 8GB class 2.

5. FAT32

6. Default Windows format, not sure offhand.

7. Original game minna no tetris got 0.09A in normal play. Same game mode on Omega 0.20 to 0.22A on NOR and about the same on RAM. Clean boot both times. This is the same that I got in my older tests.

It did write to NOR on this mode, though the power it drew during this was even higher -- 0.3A at times. During boot it gets as low as 0.15A which would be far better.

I tried some other original games just in case that was really low or something.

Prince of Persia sands of time European version was about 0.12A in game. Denki Blocks 0.08A. MotoGP 0.10 to 0.11A.
